page.title: 04CITY-CENTRE DEVELOPMENTS 2
page.content: The local Retailers Association have argued that if the proposed development were to go ahead it would be the end for the small private shops which still remain and contribute to the unique character of the city centre.It is also felt that more than enough shops currently exist and that there is not the population to support yet another massive retail expansion. Although seen to be protecting their own interests evidence from other Scottish towns where new shopping centres have become "white elephants" would seem to support this arguement at least. Another marked change has been the increase of expensive specialised shops and those selling luxury goods such as fitted bathrooms.Also quite a few expensive male and female clothes
